list.name: Default
list.comment: Fixed an initialization problem during refresh, to make sure google charts is initialized.

task.summary: Default task
Use AngularJS, drop Backbone/React. Use WebStorm to edit and manage source files.
Routing and Multiple Views working (see https://docs.angularjs.org/tutorial/step_07)
Added page top. Added side menu. Added a google chart for bill trends, sample data is hard-coded.
Added missing js and css files (downloaded from existing site).
More missing script files.
Asynchronous data retrieval in the controller, using Promise and Then.

Building Google Chart from the data that is retrieved from the PowerStub. New function to arrange data from the API to look the way the chart needs it. When Google Charts is replaced, the helper funcition will also need to be replaced (or just erased).

Building Google Chart from the data that is retrieved from the PowerStub. New function to arrange data from the API to look the way the chart needs it. When Google Charts is replaced, the helper funcition will also need to be replaced (or just erased).
Created a json format to make groups of meters, give them names. Created a report page that reads the list, makes it grouped, indented, and expandable.
Make list of accounts collapsable/expandable.
Use Angular's ui-chart to present the list of meters, and make it collapsable. Use embedded lists for the settings page.

Add a dropdown to select a grouping. Define a second grouping in the settings file. Change which grouping is used when the dropdown changes. Note: group values are not re-calculated. The dropdown does not control which grouping is being used, only causes a change.
Grouping can be changed from dropdown.
Groupings are matched to the list of premises, which is returned from the main application. Totals are calculated for each of the groupings.
Grid columns are resizable and moveable. Multiple account support added.
Create a default grouping from the list of accounts.
Pin the first column of account report. Created second set of demo data, and a mechanism to switch between the two.
Allow the side menu to be collapsed, to make more room for the table. Added many more table fields (square footage, demand) and many more calculations (cost per square foot).

Updated square footage values in settings file to match sample data from Kevin. Retrieve and calculate emissions data. More checks to see if numbers exist before mathing them. Retrieve and calculate change in consumption over last month.
Formmatting within the table (dollar signs, commas, right align, decimal places), and resize the table automatically. Scrollbar on side is gone.
Allow table to adjust height automatically, and not have a side scroll bar. Add row for totals, give it a unique colour. Improve data loading on refresh (not complete).
Formatting and column widths. Special effort on ft2.
Detail report can reload now. Code cleanup - smaller functions, more files, to make this easier to follow.
Menu tools working better on small screens,
Added charts to represent data from the detailed reports.
Fixed an initialization problem during refresh, to make sure google charts is initialized.

MESSAGE.value: Use AngularJS, drop Backbone/React. Use WebStorm to edit and manage source files.
Routing and Multiple Views working (see https://docs.angularjs.org/tutorial/step_07)
Added page top. Added side menu. Added a google chart for bill trends, sample data is hard-coded.
Added missing js and css files (downloaded from existing site).
More missing script files.
Asynchronous data retrieval in the controller, using Promise and Then.

Building Google Chart from the data that is retrieved from the PowerStub. New function to arrange data from the API to look the way the chart needs it. When Google Charts is replaced, the helper funcition will also need to be replaced (or just erased).
Created a json format to make groups of meters, give them names. Created a report page that reads the list, makes it grouped, indented, and expandable.
Make list of accounts collapsable/expandable.
Use Angular's ui-chart to present the list of meters, and make it collapsable. Use embedded lists for the settings page.

Add a dropdown to select a grouping. Define a second grouping in the settings file. Change which grouping is used when the dropdown changes. Note: group values are not re-calculated. The dropdown does not control which grouping is being used, only causes a change.
Grouping can be changed from dropdown.
Groupings are matched to the list of premises, which is returned from the main application. Totals are calculated for each of the groupings.
Grid columns are resizable and moveable. Multiple account support added.
Create a default grouping from the list of accounts.
Pin the first column of account report. Created second set of demo data, and a mechanism to switch between the two.
Allow the side menu to be collapsed, to make more room for the table. Added many more table fields (square footage, demand) and many more calculations (cost per square foot).

Updated square footage values in settings file to match sample data from Kevin. Retrieve and calculate emissions data. More checks to see if numbers exist before mathing them. Retrieve and calculate change in consumption over last month.
Formmatting within the table (dollar signs, commas, right align, decimal places), and resize the table automatically. Scrollbar on side is gone.
Allow table to adjust height automatically, and not have a side scroll bar. Add row for totals, give it a unique colour. Improve data loading on refresh (not complete).
Formatting and column widths. Special effort on ft2.
Detail report can reload now. Code cleanup - smaller functions, more files, to make this easier to follow.
Menu tools working better on small screens,
Added charts to represent data from the detailed reports.
Fixed an initialization problem during refresh, to make sure google charts is initialized.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Fixed an initialization problem during refresh, to make sure google charts is initialized.
